name: aquaporin 5

pid.name: Stabilization and expansion of the E-cadherin adherens junction

summary: Aquaporin 5 (AQP5) is a water channel protein.  Aquaporins are a family of small integral membrane proteins related to the major intrinsic protein (MIP or AQP0). Aquaporin 5 plays a role in the generation of saliva, tears and pulmonary secretions. AQP0, AQP2, AQP5, and AQP6 are closely related and all map to 12q13. [provided by RefSeq, Jul 2008].
